content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a possible implementation of the `extract_julia_code` function in Julia:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    blocks = Markdown.Parser.parse(md)
    code_blocks = filter(block -> block isa Markdown.Code, blocks)
    code = join(code.code for block in code_blocks if block.language == "julia")
    return code
end
```

This function uses the `Markdown` package to parse the markdown document and extract the code blocks. It then filters out the code blocks that are written in Julia and joins them together with a newline. The resulting string is returned.

Please note that you need to have the `Markdown` package installed in your Julia environment to use this function. You can install it by running `]add Markdown` in the Julia REPL.

Also, this function assumes that the code blocks are written in the standard markdown format, i.e., they are enclosed in triple backticks (```) and the language is specified after the first set of backticks. If the code blocks are written in a different format, this function may not work correctly.
